caption.p: Important parameters that influence variability and adaptability of RNA virus populations

tr.td: Average number of mutations per genome within the viral population of an infected individual
Generally averages 1–100 (more in some cases) mutations per genome
Estimated at between 10 −4 to 10 −5 mutations per nucleotide per cycle of replication
Variable, but an acutely infected organism may harbor 10 9–10 12 viral particles at any given time
Mutations needed for a phenotypic change
Many recorded adaptive changes depend on one or a few mutations
